name: Second Harvest Food Bank
mission: Summer Meals Second Harvest works with school districts and community partners to maximize the use of federally funded school meals.
theoryOfChange: Nutritious food is the foundation for a healthy, productive life; Second Harvest distributes nutritious food across Silicon Valley through programs and a partner network, and also supports enrollment in CalFresh and provides nutrition education and advocacy to strengthen food assistance and address root causes of hunger.
zakatClaimEvidence: Second Harvest of Silicon Valley's website and donation pages, including their 'Ways to Give' [2], 'Donation FAQs' [3], and 'Donate Funds' [10] sections, do not explicitly mention 'zakat' as a donation option or a dedicated fund. There is no statement indicating they accept or are compliant with zakat donations. (Source: https://www.shfb.org/give-help/donate-money/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

There is no statement indicating they accept or are compliant with zakat donations. (Source: https://www.shfb.org/give-help/donate-money/)

all_citations.claim: The organization holds a 100/100 score and holds 9.5 months of working capital.
Total revenue was $286,205,684 with a program expense ratio of 94.8% and fundraising efficiency of $0.03 per $1 raised.
The organization serves a high volume of average monthly clients to address regional hunger.
The charity provides significant grants and assistance to domestic organizations and individuals.
The organization accepts general charitable donations and sadaqah to support its food programs.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall score due to its high data confidence and exceptional financial health, though its alignment score is moderated by its status as a general humanitarian provider rather than a niche-focused charity.

High cost per beneficiary relative to international food distribution models

dimension_explanations.alignment: The cause urgency is rated as extreme due to the high cost of living and food insecurity in Silicon Valley [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact through direct provision of food, utilizing 94.8% of its total revenue of $286,205,684 for program services [1][2]. Its effectiveness is underscored by a perfect financial health rating and a robust working capital of 9.5 months, ensuring stability in its mission to maximize federally funded school meals and community grocery programs [1][4].

baseline_narrative.headline: Second Harvest of Silicon Valley serves as a critical nutritional lifeline for Northern California, maintaining a perfect 100.0/100 from Charity Navigator score through exceptional financial efficiency.
strengths: Exceptional financial efficiency with a fundraising efficiency of $0.03 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity with 9.5 months of working capital available
High transparency and accountability with a perfect 100.0/100 from Charity Navigator rating
baseline_narrative.summary: Second Harvest of Silicon Valley is a leading hunger-relief organization that distributes food through grocery programs and community partnerships to address extreme poverty in the region [1][3]. The organization reported a total revenue of $286,205,684 while maintaining a high program expense ratio of 94.8% [2].

areas_for_improvement.context: Following pandemic-era peaks, the organization has seen a <cite id="2">3-Year Revenue CAGR: -5.8%</cite>, indicating a normalization of funding that requires careful long-term planning.
While providing critical humanitarian aid, the organization does not have specific programs tailored to Islamic giving frameworks, making it SADAQAH-ELIGIBLE only.

bbb_assessment.summary: Meets all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards for Charity Accountability

case_against.mitigation_notes: The revenue contraction is typical for domestic food banks post-COVID, and the organization maintains excellent reserves to buffer this transition.
case_against.summary: There are very few operational concerns, though the <cite id="2">3-Year Revenue CAGR: -5.8%</cite> reflects a post-pandemic contraction in top-line funding.

confidence.notes: Excellent transparency and highly consistent financial reporting across multiple authoritative platforms.

known_gaps: Specific cost-per-meal metrics not explicitly detailed in standard filings

alignment.explanation: The organization addresses the urgent cause of extreme poverty locally, though it operates in a well-covered space and is strictly SADAQAH-ELIGIBLE.
alignment.improvement: Add a dedicated page or clearly state whether donations can be directed to specific underserved populations to improve donor fit.

credibility.explanation: The charity exhibits top-tier credibility with a <cite id="1">100.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, a PLATINUM Candid seal, and adherence to <cite id="6">all 20 BBB standards</cite>.

impact.explanation: Impact is highly efficient, driven by a <cite id="2">Program Expense Ratio: 94.6%</cite> and an incredible <cite id="1">Fundraising Efficiency: $0.03 per $1 raised</cite>.
impact.improvement: To further strengthen impact measurement, the organization could publish more granular cost-per-meal metrics alongside its broad client counts.

rich_narrative.headline: Second Harvest of Silicon Valley serves as a critical nutritional lifeline for Northern California, maintaining a perfect 100.100.0/100 from Charity Navigator score through exceptional financial efficiency.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support highly efficient, large-scale local hunger relief in Northern California through general sadaqah.
donor_motivations: Value exceptional financial efficiency and low overhead
Want to support local community safety nets in the Bay Area
Prefer established institutions with perfect accountability ratings
giving_considerations: Donations are pooled into massive general operating funds
Strictly sadaqah-eligible, not suitable for zakat obligations
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill specific zakat obligations or those looking to fund international relief efforts.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Strong tracking of outputs (clients served, pounds distributed) and verified financial efficiency, though lacking formal RCTs.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Provides direct food assistance and funds local community partners to alleviate hunger and improve nutritional outcomes in Silicon Valley.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Tracking client volume and grant distribution ensures that the massive scale of funding translates directly into community nourishment.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Despite massive scale, the high cost of living in Silicon Valley drives continuous demand for food assistance.
strategic_priorities: Transition from crisis response to sustainable operations

strengths.detail: The organization operates with remarkable leanness, boasting a <cite id="2">Program Expense Ratio: 94.6%</cite> and an outstanding <cite id="1">Fundraising Efficiency: $0.03 per $1 raised</cite>.
Donors can give with high confidence as the charity maintains a <cite id="1">100.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite> and holds a PLATINUM seal of transparency from Candid.
The food bank operates at an institutional scale, reaching an <cite id="3">average monthly clients served: 500000</cite> across its service areas.

strengths_deep_dive: Second Harvest of Silicon Valley distinguishes itself through its ability to process massive volumes of food and funding with minimal overhead. By maintaining a <cite id="2">Program Expense Ratio: 94.6%</cite>, it significantly outperforms the <cite id="2">Peer Program Ratio Median: 89.6%</cite>. The organization's financial health is further solidified by its strong liquidity, holding <cite id="1">9.5 months of working capital</cite> in reserve. Furthermore, its governance is robust, meeting <cite id="6">all 20 BBB standards</cite> and operating with a large, independent board.
rich_narrative.summary: Second Harvest of Silicon Valley serves as a critical nutritional lifeline for Northern California, addressing food insecurity through extensive grocery programs and community partnerships. Founded in <cite id="5">1974</cite>, the organization has scaled to become one of the most efficient food banks in the nation. In its recent filings, the charity reported <cite id="2">Total Revenue: $286,205,684</cite> and demonstrated exceptional financial stewardship with a <cite id="2">Program Expense Ratio: 94.6%</cite>. The organization's massive scale is evident in its reach, having supported an <cite id="3">average monthly clients served: 500000</cite> during peak periods. It operates with high transparency, earning a <cite id="1">100.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite> and meeting <cite id="6">all 20 BBB standards</cite> for charity accountability. The organization also acts as a significant distributor of resources, providing substantial <cite id="4">Grants and assistance to domestic organizations: 126143515</cite> to local partners.
